Question: This person was not revered in his lifetime, but he received a large amount of praise.
Hints: It was prefaced with a poem by Ben Jonson, in which this person is hailed, presciently, as "not of an age, but for all time.".
Nevertheless, poet and critic John Dryden rated this person highly, saying of Jonson, "I admire him, but I love this person".
This person influenced novelists such as Thomas Hardy, William Faulkner, and Charles Dickens.
